'''Morelull''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ネマシュ''' ''Nemasyu'') is a dual-type {{2t|Grass|Fairy}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VII]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Shiinotic}} starting at [[level]] 24.

==Biology==
Morelull is a small, white Pokémon similar to a mushroom. It has large, black eyes with pale green half-circle markings on the outer side. Small bumps ring the top of its head, similar to hair. Its head is much larger than its thin, stem-like body. At the base, the stem splits into three green roots that act as feet. Three large mushrooms sprout from the center of its head. Each mushroom has a thin white stem and a darker ring of color around the base of the cap. The center and largest mushroom is light pink, while the other two mushrooms are smaller and a light purplish-blue. At night, Morelull can make the spores filling their mushroom caps glow with blue light.

A nocturnal Pokémon, Morelull moves every night to a new location. It likes dark damp areas, but moves around to avoid depriving the plants in any one area of too many nutrients. In addition to locomotion, its roots are also used to make communicate with other Morelull. When in danger, it scatters spores that burst into bright, glittering sparks. The pulsing light of the spores can induce drowsiness.<ref>http://www.pokemon-sunmoon.com/en-us/pokemon/morelull/</ref> It is rumored that once, when a group of Morelull were disturbed and all threw out their spores at once, a plane passing overhead suffered a near brush with disaster.<ref>http://www.pokemon.co.jp/ex/sun_moon/pokemon/160812_01.html</ref>

==In the anime==
[[File:Morelull anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Morelull in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Multiple Morelull debuted in ''[[SM029|Lulled to La-La Land!]]'', where they evolved into {{p|Shiinotic}}. One Morelull had been draining energy from {{Ash}} and {{ashcl}} to help sustain a tree.

===Minor appearances===
Two Morelull appeared in ''[[SM039|Mallow and the Forest Teacher!]]'', where they helped provide light at {{DL|Recurring wild Pokémon in the anime|Oranguru}}'s bar. They reappeared in [[SM062]], once again providing light.

A Morelull appeared in [[SM059]], during a flashback.

==Trivia==
* Morelull and its {{p|Shiinotic|evolved form}} are the only Pokémon that can have {{a|Rain Dish}} that cannot learn {{m|Rain Dance}}.
* Morelull can be seen as a counterpart to {{p|Paras}}. Both share the {{t|Grass}} type and the same base stat totals, both can learn {{m|Spore}}, and both can be found in the wild in [[Pokémon Sun and Moon]], taking the place of the other depending on the [[time]], with Morelull being found during the night and Paras at day.

===Origin===
Morelull may be based on bioluminescent mushrooms such as those of the genus ''{{wp|Mycena}}''. It is also likely based on {{wp|fairy rings}}.

Given that some of the foreign names of [[Shiinotic (Pokémon)|its evolution]] include the word "lamp", and that Morelull shine lights and put people to sleep, it may also be based on a {{wp|nightlight}}.

====Name origin====
Morelull may be a combination of ''{{wp|Morchella|morel}}'' and ''lull''.

Nemasyu may be a combination of 寝 ''ne'' (sleep) and ''mushroom''.
